title: Project-Based Learning Design Utilizing Cognitive Load Theory and Neuroimaging

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Advanced social science course in a limited-technology (smartphone-focused) environment: Learners apply cognitive load theory to real-world instructional design problems

learning_goals: Learners can design assessment tools to distinguish intrinsic/extrinsic/germane cognitive load under various learning conditions.
Learners can interpret neuroimaging research findings and propose cognitive load measurement indicators applicable to instructional design.
Learners can develop a cognitive load-optimized instructional model feasible in limited technological environments through project-based learning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
